name: Tabletop Game and Hobby 2014 Store Champion 1st Place Deck
description: This deck went 5-0-1. There were 4 Flat Line wins and 1 Agena win.

name: For the love of Ash
description: RP and Ash with some nice surprises, enough said.

name: Bankroll Kate
description: Get a suite out, make ridiculous amounts of money, break everything, while keeping cash to prevent getting traced etc efficiency is key. Idea started when i was making a (what I consider) typical current runner deck. It had all the tricks etc that you expect, but I noticed I was running naked alot. Also not having the correct breakers or enough money at key moments was annoying. This really is a back to basics deck. Interested in hearing what you guys think! Could this be even remotely competitive?

name: I have no idea what I'm doing
description: I think this is an okay deck? I'd like advice, I just started playing.

name: Breakers 'n' Money - Store Championship First Place
description: A Toolbox Kate deck. Few weaknesses, save for making the right choice at the right time-can be difficult to play. Can hit HQ and R&D hard, but primarily focuses on remote lock, using RDI or Nerve agent as the killshot.

name: GRNDL - Store Championship First Place
description: Supermodernism variant running GRNDL. Flatlined every game. I want more ice in the list, but still working out how to do it.

name: Nice or Naughty 1.2
description:
Got to the top 8 in the Store Championships with this baby.

The plan is to setup the three-card combo: Aesop's, NACH, and A. Support. This will enable Blackmail, the star of the deck.

While getting there, play The Source to stall them out. Drop all your Levys, you'll need them later when all your Blackmails and SOTs are gone.

Use Capstone to accelerate toward your Blackmails by trashing redundant Daily Casts, Aesops, NACHs, etc.

On the off case that they get to rez ICE (i.e. BioEff Research, Oversight, PriReq), keep a Femme handy, to steal the next dropped agenda.

While the Source is out, any silly drop or advanced card is Blackmailable. Unless it's Jinteki. :p

name: ChaosTheorySpinalContacts
Job's Done
description:
This is a fast advance deck. Engineering The Future gives you a nice credit boost all game, padding those dry spells between money assets.

Agendas: I stuffed as many 3 for 2s as I could in, as well as Gila Hands for some cash you don't have to protect. Efficiency Committee clicks can't fast advance, but they combo well with Melange, Gila Hands, and even Private Contracts.

Assests: Melange and Private Contracts work well when you're getting set up, or waiting for another agenda surface. And don't be afraid to use your bonus clicks get some cash in a pinch. Meanwhile, Eve works wonders when you have a hand full of agenda you're trying score back to back. Haas Arcology AI makes for easy fast advance if you can protect it, as does Director Haas, though she's riskier. Trash the Director if you can't protect her, she can't be scored from the archives.

Upgrades: If you don't understand SanSan City Grid for fast advance, this deck is not for you.

Operations: By now, you see what's happening here. HB doesn't have the AstroScripts that NBN has, but makes up for it with bonus clicks. Drop a 3 cost agenda, play Biotic Labor, advance, advance, advance, score, profit.

Ice: Here I built a mix of early game run ending and mid game stalling. Try to trash decoders and fracters early and often so you can continue to stall out for a mid game win. If the runner gets a full suite you're in trouble. Best bet at that point is to try to cover R&D hard and grind money while you wait for your deck to cough up that final agenda. Tollbooth is your best friend when trying to slow the runners momentum.

name: Kit-Siphon Rush-Store Championship 4th place
description:
This deck went 2-2 at my local store championship. I think that it's a promising concept, but it definitely needs some tweaking. The main goal is R&D lock, however once they got 3-4 pieces of ice over it, it was incredibly hard to get in. When that happens normally I'd start hitting HQ pretty hard with siphon spam and an escher run to be able to get back into R&D, however I was never able to pull an escher run during the tournament. This deck lost to an HB NEXT Design fast advance deck that was scoring agendas out of hand with biotic, and it got sea/scorch/scorched on the second turn against GRNDL.

Indexing was nice, i'd usually put agendas 3 down and 5 down to give me time to build up money since kit's ability only allows for one strong run each turn, however I think that I will replace it with makers eye, because I think it fits with kit's ability better. I'll probably also replace daily casts with armitage.

name: Gryfalia's Aerie Store Champion 3-1-14 (25 Players, 6-0)
description: I was TO; decklist published by permission.

name: Gryfalia's Aerie Store Champion 3-1-14 (25 Players, 6-1)
description: I was TO; decklist published by permission.

name: Magnum Knightman (v1.1)
description: My current take on djackman's Knightman archetype. Added Inti to deal with Wraparound, and replaced ProCon with Opus to free up some card slots. Since Opus and Knight are click-intensive, I kept Daily Casts to provide some clickless econ. ProCon's draw is now 3x Diesel.

name: Operation: Never Advance (2nd at Myriad Store Championship)
description:
This is the corp deck I ran alongside my Professor deck (http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/2774/the-professorial-anarch-2nd-at-myriad-store-championship-) for the Myriad Games Store Championship in Salem, NH on 3/1/14.

Pretty standard NBN here, but running a lot of money to be able to pay for SanSans and Ash while (hopefully) weathering the Account Siphon storm.

The deck got eviscerated pretty hard by the eventual Store Champ who was running 3 Rabbit Holes and Magnum Opus in what can only be termed straight up Making News hate.... but otherwise was 3-1 in Swiss and won the first match of elimination for me.

name: Jinteki - Tax - Store Championship 4th place
description:
This deck went 2-2 at my local store championship. In both games that it won it worked like clockwork. Basically this deck puts 1-2 punishing ice in front of all the centrals, then one big remote with Ash to score agendas in. Usually assets would have no ice, with encryption protocol to protect them, however i think i am going to start putting cheap ice in front of sundews and melanges, because one game I lost was due to the econ denial of the runner trashing them.

I think the main problem with this deck is the ice makeup. I'll probably pull out ichi for tollbooth, and i want to pull out neural katana for something but I'm not sure what yet.

name: jinteki v1
Tag, I have it!
Event Chaos
Kit-Osaurus
description: This is a "Kit" deck I'm playtesting and tweaking for an upcoming tournament in March. The basic premise is to hit the centrals hard and make the corp rez ICE to keep them protected. It relies on the strong combo of Yog hosted on Dinosaurus to do most of the dirty work because only the most expensive ICE can't hold up to it. For everything else there's Atmans and Femme should you come across an annoyingly large piece of ICE.

name: Your Lightning Fast News Team
description: Basic fast advance deck using biotic labors to help make sure you get one turn agendas against faster runners. Lots of ETR ICE make it hard for the runner to get some early accesses and you need to use that time to pop out some agendas and get points quickly. The idea is that by the time the runner has the tools he needs, you'r already 2 points from victory. Feel free to offer suggestions as I'm very open to criticism.

name: Noise Hemmorage
Reina's Game
description: A fun little Anarch deck I built that loves to punish the corp player's economy. Reina's ability combined with Xanadu is fun and gets even better once rooks are involved. The deck also has plenty of MU for Caissas, viruses, and a full compliment of icebreakers. As with most Anarch decks, you really only need a couple of things on the board before you can just go and ruin the corp's day. Looking for suggestions and improvements.

name: Haas's Bioroids
description: Sort of a mixture between a Big ICE deck and a click advantage deck. The main goal is to set up a really hard to run board with really efficient Bioroid ICE and sit behind it advancing agendas. This is very much a first draft and I haven't tested it much yet.

name: Grndl bug
description: advance everything twice. pretend like everything is a grndl refinery. try to put one of those down first so they run everything. enjoy your junebug kill or your four tags from ghost branch.

name: Andromeda's Big Score
description: Criminal at it's essence. Get lots of money, make the corp spend money, get a full rig fast and just run to victory. Lawyer Up combos very nicely with account siphon to get you up to 10 credits and 3 cards for 3 clicks. Singleton Decoy allows you to better deal with Weyland combos than a plascrete so I basically replaced one plascrete with it.

name: Weyland - Murder Hobos
description: Yep, this is Weyland. Land a tag, win the game with a Scorched Earth or two. You can also feel free to hide agendas in your archives thanks to Jackson Howard and sometimes even let the runner get them for some follow up Punitive Counterstrikes the following turn. This deck also features the Power Shutdown/Accelerated Diagnostics combo that has become infamous of late in my local meta.

name: Jinteconomy
description: My version of the Jinteki Never Trash deck. I'm hoping to run it in an upcoming local tournament this month. The basic idea is just to make it extremely cost inefficient (in terms of both clicks and credits) for the runner to run on your remote servers. Try to get economy going through Sundews and PAD Campaigns early. Most runners won't try to trash a PAD campaign, but you will probably need some sort of protection for the Sundews early. Use Interns to recur whatever the runner ends up trashing (it most likely cost him more than it cost you) and most of the time the runner will give up on trashing your economy which gives you a big advantage. Protect Agendas in a strong remote with Ash and possibly a Hokusai and you'll find the runner needs to invest at least 3 clicks and a truckload of credits just to access your single agenda. I'm looking for suggestions on how to make the deck more competitive and improve it in general.

name: Toc Toc!
description: C'est fermé! Pas de problème, j'ai la clé.

name: R2P Store Championship Runner Deck - Donesh Gillan
description: Runner Up

name: HB Brainbuster - Store Champion Clem's Fort Wayne IN
description:
I've played this deck for a few weeks, only changing to it the night before. This deck catches a lot of runners of guard, makes tons of money, and keeps the runner out, and always questioning themselves.

Notables: 1 Win through advancing agendas, 2 flatlines and 1 loss when I drew nothing but agendas and assets. PILE SHUFFLE. Also using Vitruvious counters to refill my hand while HQ is being attacked.

Duds: None, I don't think there was a card I didn't want to see. Never stuck an EoW, but the play being there is nice, and even the when the runner trashes it, you can fairly safely install into a 3-4 ice remote and the runner has lots of pause, especially if a Sentinel defense is score.

Flatlines were after sticking 3 brain damage, triple EMP, and 1 double-advanced CO doing 4 damage before a triple EMP on my turn.

Possible changes, putting in a 3 pointer or two, just to accelerate the game win, since I can play advance or not-advance on installed cards.

name: Jalapeño Face Store Champion - Clem's Fort Wayne IN
description:
For those in attendance, and looking for a good knight deck....this was the deck I was running that went 4-0 on the day. On the course of the day I took 3 net damage from a snare, 0 meat damage. I had several really close matches that had me sweating and drawing for answers.

Top performers: KNIGHT. Knight is super awesome in Gabe. Emergency shutdown came in second and sneakdoor third pushing lots of economic pressure. Mr. Li might take third, but its hard to gauge his worth, but in Gabe, Mr. Li is king.

Duds: Daily casts. The tempo hit is just too bad for how long it takes to pay off. I think I played 1 all day, and it was insurance against being broke in the future. This stinker is coming back out for armitage or something else. Indexing under performed netting 1 2 pointer, but we'll forgive it.

Decoy was a meta call against power shutdown combo decks since GRNDL is my worst match. I'm putting in blackmail and rejiggering to include same old thing to punish this shit out of GRNDL remotes. I'd like to include HQ interface for NBN and Cerebral Imaging.

Notable plays included getting a Hadrian's to rez, femming a chimera, and then shutting down the hadrians to score a 5/3 which was advanced. Playing double plascrete turn 2 against GRNDL, going to 0 credits.

name: grndl 0.1
description: what?
